derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (as an adjective): from Old French Janne (now Gênes), from medieval Latin Janua 'Genoa', the place of original production. The noun sense comes from jean fustian, literally 'fustian from Genoa', used in the 16th cent. to denote a heavy twilled cotton cloth

encyclopedia.content: jean是一个英语单词，它是一个名词，它的意思有： n. 1.锛埬陀玫娘級斜纹棉布 2.牛仔裤;斜纹棉布裤 a pair of blue jeans 一条蓝色牛仔裤基本词义 Jean [dVi:n] n. 吉恩(①男子名， John的异体 ②女子名， Joanna的异体) 常被译为中文女子名“琼” 或者是“琴”语源 Short for obsolete jene (fustian) [Genoan (fustian)] from Middle English jene, gene from Old French Genes [Genoa]

means.word_mean: 1. (usually plural) close-fitting pants of heavy denim for casual wear
2. a coarse durable twill-weave cotton fabric
